de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller
Interface Controller

All Superinterfaces:
ObservableArtefact, ObservableUnit, ObservableUnitCustom
All Known Implementing Classes:
ControllerImpl
public interface Controller
extends ObservableArtefact, ObservableUnit, ObservableUnitCustom

Controller
Controller interface provides the methods to get access to the controller and model layer.

It is not permitted to access the model layer directly. Instead one has to access the model via the controller layer. The controller has all informations about how to access the model layer.

Since:
Mar/24/09
Version:
0.1
Author:
Michael Munz

Method Detail

loadEcoreModel

org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EPackage loadEcoreModel(org.eclipse.emf.common.util.URI uri)
Using the EMF persistence framework enables us to load a XMI serialized form of UML models, called Ecore.

Notice, the Ecore meta model lays outside the system and is loaded into it using the EMF persistance framework.

Parameters:
uri - the URI specifies the path to a *.ecore file return meta model

loadEcoreModel

org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EPackage loadEcoreModel(java.lang.String uri)
Parameters:
uri - URI.toString as input parameter
Returns:
ecore meta model in-memory
See Also:
loadEcoreModel(URI)

sets the ecore meta model into Model layer.

Parameters:
ePackage -

getEcoreModel

org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EPackage getEcoreModel()
gets the ecore meta model from the Model layer.

Returns:
ecore in-memory

printEcoreModel

void printEcoreModel(org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EPackage ePackage)
print the current ecore model to console. Only for testing purposes.

Parameters:
ePackage - the ecore meta model

loadStartupFile

void loadStartupFile(java.net.URI xml,
                     java.net.URI xsd)
this method is highly important because it loads a xml file at startup time. To indicate the failure of loading, an exception is thrown to the invoker. In this case, the exception has to be handled properly and the whole application is going to get shut down immediately.

It could also be, that the XML file is not valid. A valid file is described by a XSD file. Both files are shipped with the application.

Parameters:
xml - a startup file needed at initializing phase.
xsd - XML Schema Definition, describing the XML.
Throws:
if - the application can't start properly. That happens when starup file is corrupted or invalid or other bad things have had happened.

addArtefact

void addArtefact(Artefact artefact)
For each artefact type there exists one artefact collection holding all artefact elements of one type.

At any time, the following must hold:
  • N_AT = number of artefact types
  • N_A = number of artefacts
N_AT = N_A

Parameters:
artefact - a new artefact collection

getArtefacts

java.util.List<Artefact> getArtefacts()
gets the artefacts data structure from the model layer. That could be a whole bunch of different artefacts. With this method all are returned.

Returns:
artefact object

getArtefact

Artefact getArtefact(ArtefactType type)
gets an artefact collection holding a whole bunch of classes. It's only a subset of the complete artefacts, because we splitted the set in disjunct artefact types. Those types are initially available or they are added by the tester.

Parameters:
type - tells which subset of artefacts to get
Returns:
artefact object defined by the type or null

getMetaClass

MetaClass getMetaClass(java.lang.String name,
                       ArtefactType type)
tries to find a meta class with a given name. The type helps to determine the collection where to start the search.

Parameters:
name - looking for a meta class by name
type - determines the collection to look for
Returns:
meta class with given name or null

iteratorArtefacts

iterator

addToArtefact

boolean addToArtefact(MetaClass artefact)
adds one artefact of a particular type to the data structure. To avoid duplicate artefacts, it's run a check first.

Parameters:
artefact - has to be one of the supported types of artefacts.
Returns:
true, if operation has been successful.

createArtefacts

void createArtefacts(java.util.List<MetaClass> selection,
                     DataGeneratorView view)
This method is one of the most important!
This is the place to go, when the data structure of the EMF Ecore Model is initially build up.

It adds a list of available artefacts into the data structure. This method is supposed to be called, when the user has chosen the initial list of artefacts.

Based on that list the data structure is build up.

Parameters:
selection - the list of artefacts the user has chosen or selected respectively.
view - referece of main view. This is where most of the components are nested. In other words, it's the view you see, when the application starts.

getArtefacts

java.util.List<MetaClass> getArtefacts(org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EPackage ePackage)
before any data structre can be build up, the system needs to know which artefacts are used. That is especially important for any subsequent computation.

This method iterates throught the Ecore model and picks only the classes out of it. Those classes are then shown to the user which in turn has to select artefacts to generate test data.

Parameters:
ePackage - Ecore Model
Returns:
list of meta classes describing the available artefacts

addArtefactType

void addArtefactType(ArtefactType type)
adds an new artefact type to the list of supported types. Remember, those types are highly important, because they match loaded EMF data to a particular collection. Each single data is adhered to a artefact type and separate different types. At all times, there're exactly as much different collections as artefact types.

Parameters:
type - new artefact type

addArtefactType

void addArtefactType(java.lang.String name,
                     boolean createDummyFile)
adds an new artefact type to the list of supported types. Remember, those types are highly important, because they match loaded EMF data to a particular collection. Each single data is adhered to a artefact type and separate different types. At all times, there're exactly as much different collections as artefact types.

Parameters:
name - a string defines the new artefact type
createDummyFile - this flag is used to indicate, whether or not physical dummy files are desired.

getArtefactTypes

java.util.List<ArtefactType> getArtefactTypes()
gets the list of supported artefact types. At any time there are as much collections as artefact types.

Returns:
list of artefact types.

getArtefactType

ArtefactType getArtefactType(java.lang.String name)
tries to find an artefact type by a given name. The method doesn't do a containing check. If you wanna be sure that this type is really available, use the following method first:
hasArtefactType(String)

Parameters:
name - the name of an artefact type
Returns:
the artefact type or null

removeArtefactType

boolean removeArtefactType(java.lang.String name)
removes an artefact type from the available artefact type list in model layer and its corresponding artefact collection. The latter step is necessary, because the number of artefact types and the number of artefact collections are always the same. It wouldn't make much sense to advertise something we don't have.

Parameters:
name - the name of the artefact type given as a string
Returns:
true, if successfully removed

removeArtefactType

boolean removeArtefactType(ArtefactType type)
This method is like the above one, but with an artefact type as parameter. It removes an artefact type from the available artefact type list in model layer and its corresponding artefact collection. The latter step is necessary, because the number of artefact types and the number of artefact collections are always the same. It wouldn't make much sense to advertise something we don't have.

Parameters:
type - artefact type to remove
Returns:
true, if successfully removed

hasArtefactType

boolean hasArtefactType(java.lang.String name)
checks, whether an artefact type is supported or not. If this method finds a type with the given name as input, true is returned, otherwise false.

Parameters:
name - looking for a artefact type with that name
Returns:
true, if artefact in model layer has been found

gets the iterator for artefact types.

Returns:
iterator

getNoOfAttributes

int getNoOfAttributes()
keeps track of the amount of attributes above all artefact collections. This is a global number. Notice, each artefact collection has still its own counter.

Returns:
number of attributes as a global amount

getNoOfClasses

int getNoOfClasses()
keeps track of the number above artefact collections. This is a global number and each artefact collection has still its own counter.

Returns:
number of classes (global)

parsedArtefactTypes

void parsedArtefactTypes(java.util.List<ArtefactType> artefactTypes)
The parsed artefact types of the startup.xml file.

Parameters:
artefactTypes - types of this type

setLogging

void setLogging(boolean logging)
the job of this method is to set the logging flag. At the initial stage, the logging is enabled. This helps to track down any problems by examining the log file. Remember, this is a prototype, and it is recommended to log.

Because logging is time consuming and slows down the system performance, we log only when an exception or error occurs. If no unexpected things happen no log file will be created, but logging is still enabled.

Parameters:
logging - should the system log if any unexpected exception is thrown?

isLogging

boolean isLogging()
gets the current setting for the logging mechanism.

Returns:
if logging enabled true otherwise false

setPRNG

void setPRNG(java.lang.String prng)
sets the pseudo random number generator (PRNG). If this method is used, the default PRNG is overwritten with this one. The value passed in comes from the setup.xml file at startup.

The default generator is MersenneTwister.

Parameters:
prng - at startup the default PRNG can be defined to use for number generation. There are conventions on which one are available. The supported one are listed in PRNG.
See Also:
PRNG

setPRNG

void setPRNG(PRNG prng)
sets the pseudo random number generator (PRNG). If this method is used, the default PRNG is overwritten with this one. The value passed in comes from the setup.xml file at startup.

The default generator is MersenneTwister.

Parameters:
prng - at startup the default PRNG can be defined to use for number generation. There are conventions on which one are available. The supported one are listed in PRNG.
See Also:
PRNG

getPRNG

PRNG getPRNG()
gets the pseudo random number generator used to generate numbers. The default is MersenneTwister. But in setup.xml an alternative one could be defined to use instead.

Returns:
PRNG

setUnits

void setUnits(java.util.List<Unit> units)
sets the unit list at once. This method is usually called, when the startup.xml file has been parsed.

Parameters:
units - list of units

addUnit

void addUnit(Unit unit)
adds an unit element to the list. This might happen, when testers add new once.

Parameters:
unit - a new unit element

getUnits

java.util.List<Unit> getUnits()

list of units

iteratorUnit

iterator

setRawDate

void setRawDate(int lower,
                int upper)
sets the upper and lower dates as simple integers. The values are passed to the controller by the XML parser and the values come from the startup XML file.

Remember, because these are still integers, the controller does the conversion to date objects.

The method is used to be able to generate dates in an specific interval. The interval boundaries are defined by these values. It could be possible that the upper bound is not specified clearly, that is the value is 0. The controller will take in that case the current year. Whereas the lower bound of the date interval has to be specified at all times.

Parameters:
lower - the lower bound of the date interval
upper - the upper bound of the date interval

createAndRegisterGenerator

void createAndRegisterGenerator(ObserverGenerator observer)
as the method name says, it creates the fill behaviour generators. Each time a generator is created and the observer is registered to it, the observable generator sends a notification to the UI. With this notification the UI registers the generator into a list which is then available to users.

Parameters:
observer - observer is needed to register after creation of any generator. Remember, generators are fill behaviour.

unregisterGenerator

void unregisterGenerator(Generator generator,
                         ObserverGenerator observer)
it unregisters a generator from the list of available generators in UI. The result is, users won't be able to select this generator anymore.

Parameters:
generator - a generator to dismiss from UI list.
observer - unregistration is initiated by observer

createAndRegisterDistribution

void createAndRegisterDistribution(ObserverDistribution observer)
as the method name already tells it creates the probability distributions and passes the observer to them to register. Any observer which needs to know which probability distributions are available in model layer needs to register to them. This is, because any layer above the controller must access via the controller layer.

Parameters:
observer - it's usually a component in the view layer to get the latest updates on available probability distributions hanging around in the model layer.

unregisterDistribution

void unregisterDistribution(ProbabilityDistribution distribution,
                            ObserverDistribution observer)
of course, it's possible to unregister any probability distribution. Unregistering in terms of probability distributions means the controller removes them from the model layer. So the removed ones are no longer available in the model. Because the view layer doesn't know about that a change had happened, a notification has to be send out by the subject which is gonna be deleted. If notification doesn't happen or the view layer can't rely on that users have the choice to select unavailable probability distributions. And that's definitely not what's intended.

Parameters:
distribution - this is the subject that is gonna be eliminated from the model layer. In other words, the subject has to make sure it's corresponding object is also removed from the view layer.
observer - no notify the observer the controller passes the observer down.
